messages.content: 9-1-1, what's your emergency?
Yes, I just shot someone in my business.
Okay, what's the address of the emergency?
5931 4th Avenue South, Seattle, Washington at Sharp's Outdoor Power.
Who did you shoot?
I don't know. There's another one here, and I have a gun on them.
Was somebody trying to break in?
Yes, they broke in the door and were taking things out.
Okay, give me a moment.
Radio. This is about shoplifters inside the business. The owner has them at gunpoint and did shoot one. One is down, one is being held at gunpoint.
Can you confirm the name of your store?
It's Sharp's Outdoor Power.
Sharp's Outdoor Power at 5931 4th Avenue South?
Yes, there's a truck in the driveway, right in front of the door. They broke in, and I'm keeping the other guy at gunpoint.
Is the person you shot bleeding?
Yes, he's not moving and he's bleeding.
Do I categorize this as a weapons call?
No, it's a burglary one.
Okay, I’m going to get the medics on the line and send help your way.
All right, the other guy is not moving.
Hang on, don't hang up yet.
Seattle Fire, Medic. What is the address?
5931 4th Avenue South. The owner shot a shoplifter and has another at gunpoint.
All right. We're sending police and medics to Sharp's Outdoor Power.
What’s your last name, sir?
My last name is [REDACTED]
And your first name?
My first name is [REDACTED]
What’s your phone number?
[REDACTED]
Can you confirm the business name again?
Sharp's Outdoor Power.
Are you in a big warehouse?
Yes, it’s a big building with a sign out front.
So they broke in your front door?
Yes, they busted the front door.
What kind of gun do you have?
A .357 Magnum revolver.
Okay, we have police in the area. They should be there any minute. Please stay on the phone with me until they arrive.
I've never shot anyone before.
I understand. You were protecting yourself and your property.
The officers should be there any minute. If you see them, let me know.
He's not going to run. He's on the floor.
I want you to stay on the phone in case something happens. Where’s your front door?
It’s broken. You can see it on the north side of the building.
Is there a truck in the driveway?
Yes, a white truck parked right at the door. It belongs to the robbers.
Okay, officers are pulling up now. Do you see them?
Yes, I see them.
As soon as you see them, you can hang up the phone with me.
I need to get some clothes on.
Okay, can you put the revolver down?
It's down.
The officers are coming in.
Stay on the line until they confirm you're safe.
I didn't know what else to do.
I understand. You did what you had to protect yourself. Are the officers there?
Yes, they have one in handcuffs. The other one is not moving.
Do you need to speak with the officers now?
Yes, they’re asking me to come out.
Okay, you can hang up now. Take care.
